newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Texaco to test Bulgarian gas well. [corrected 18:37 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Texaco to test Bulgarian gas well. [corrected 18:37 gmt]

text.p: (Corrects headline and text to delete word "wildcat" as gas well is not a wildcat well.)
Texaco Inc is preparing to start testing its gas discovery on the Bulgarian Black Sea shelf to decide whether to exploit it commercially, company's office manager in Bulgaria said on Tuesday.
"The tests are aimed at evaluating the gas volumes in the well," Katya Alexieva told Reuters.
In 1993 Texaco, which works together with Britain's Enterprise Oil Plc and Austria's OMV AG, reported a gas discovery southeast of the Black Sea port of Varna.
Texaco, which is the operator, said the well flowed at a rate of 34 million cubic feet.
"By the end of the year the investment of the three companies will total $40 million," Alexieva said.
Eight Western firms were licensed to explore six offshore and two onshore blocks for oil and gas in Bulgaria in 1991.
There are several blocks in which licensed firms will search in the next couple of years, Geology and Mineral Resources Committee officials said, adding they were optimistic for a new discovery.
